title: Profile
description:
XDM Profiles are a singular representation of the attributes of identified and
partially identified persons. Profiles that are highly identified maybe used for
personal communications or highly targeted engagements and can contain detailed
personal information such as names, gender, date of birth, locations, and contact
information like phone numbers and email addresses. Profiles may range to the
other end of the identification spectrum where only anonymous behavioral signals
are being observed and the amount of identification is simple browser cookies.
In this latter case, the sparse Profile data is useful to build more knowledge
on the interests and preferences of the anonymous profile, and over time can
become richer as the person interacting with brand becomes more engaged and
ultimately signs-on to notifications, subscriptions, purchases and other
connections with the brand that enrich and fill out the profile.

XDM Profile can contain personal information, identification information, contact
details and communication preferences. Over time XDM Profile will expand to cater
for other Profile data such as preference, propensities and other attributes.

repositoryCreatedBy.title: Created by User Identifier
repositoryCreatedBy.description: User id who has created the entity.

repositoryLastModifiedBy.title: Modified by User Identifier
repositoryLastModifiedBy.description:
User id who last modified the entity.
At creation time, `modifiedByUser` is set as `createdByUser`.

createdByBatchID.title: Created by Batch Identifier
createdByBatchID.description: The Data Set Files in Catalog Services which has been originating the creation of the entity.

modifiedByBatchID.title: Modified by Batch Identifier
modifiedByBatchID.description:
The last Data Set Files in Catalog Services which has modified the entity.
At creation time, `modifiedByBatchID` is set as `createdByBatchID`.

createDate.description: The server date and time when the resource was created in the repository, such as when an asset file is first uploaded or a directory is created by the server as the parent of a new asset. The Date Time property should conform to ISO 8601 standard. An example form is "2004-10-23T12:00:00-06:00".

lastModifiedDate.description: The server date and time when the resource was most recently modified in the repository, such as when a new version of an asset is uploaded or a directory's child resource is added or removed. The Date Time property should conform to ISO 8601 standard. An example form is "2004-10-23T12:00:00-06:00".

identities.title: All User Identities
identities.description: Array of Identities. Condensed, normalized encapsulation of all end user identifiers.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: Identity of the consumer in the related namespace.

namespace.title: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace associated with the `xid` attribute and matched up with the AAM data source integration code.

code.title: Code
code.description: The code is a human readable identifier for the namespace and can be used to request the technical namespace id which is used for identity graph processing.

xid.title: Experience Identifier
xid.description: When present, this value represents a cross-namespace identifier that is unique across all namespace-scoped identifiers in all namespaces.

primary.title: Primary
primary.description: Indicates this identity is the preferred identity. Is used as a hint to help systems better organize how identities are queried.

person.title: Person
person.description: An individual actor, contact, or owner.

firstName.title: First name
firstName.description:
The first segment of the name in the writing order most commonly accepted in the language of the name. In many cultures this is the preferred personal or given name.

The `firstName` and `lastName` properties have been introduced to maintain compatibility with existing systems that model names in a simplified, non-semantic, and non-internationalizable way. Using `xdm:fullName` is always preferable.

lastName.title: Last name
lastName.description:
The last segment of the name in the writing order most commonly accepted in the language of the name. In many cultures this is the inherited family name, surname, patronymic, or matronymic name.

The `firstName` and `lastName` properties have been introduced to maintain compatibility with existing systems that model names in a simplified, non-semantic, and non-internationalizable way. Using `xdm:fullName` is always preferable.

middleName.title: Middle name
middleName.description: Middle, alternative, or additional names supplied between the first name and last name.

courtesyTitle.title: Courtesy title
courtesyTitle.description:
Normally an abbreviation of a persons *title*, *honorific*, or *salutation*.
The `courtesyTitle` is used in front of full or last name in opening texts.
e.g Mr. Miss. or Dr J. Smith.

fullName.title: Full name
fullName.description: The full name of the person, in writing order most commonly accepted in the language of the name.

birthDay.title: Birth day
birthDay.description: The day of the month a person was born (1-31).

birthMonth.title: Birth month
birthMonth.description: The month of the year a person was born (1-12).

birthYear.title: Birth year
birthYear.description: The year a person was born including the century (yyyy, e.g 1983).

repositoryCreatedBy.description: User id who has created the entity.

repositoryLastModifiedBy.title: Modified by User Identifier
repositoryLastModifiedBy.description:
User id who last modified the entity.
At creation time, `modifiedByUser` is set as `createdByUser`.

At creation time, `modifiedByBatchID` is set as `createdByBatchID`.

_id.title: Coordinates ID
_id.description: The unique identifier of the coordinates.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of what the coordinates identify.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The signed vertical coordinate of a geographic point.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The signed horizontal coordinate of a geographic point.

elevation.title: Elevation
elevation.description: The specific elevation of the defined coordinate. The value conforms to the [WGS84](http://gisgeography.com/wgs84-world-geodetic-system/) datum and is measured in meters.

countryCode.title: Country code
countryCode.description: The two-character [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://datahub.io/core/country-list) code for the country.

stateProvince.title: State or province
stateProvince.description: The state, or province portion of the observation. The format follows the [ISO 3166-2 (country and subdivision)][http://www.unece.org/cefact/locode/subdivisions.html] standard.

postalCode.title: Postal code
postalCode.description: The postal code of the location. Postal codes are not available for all countries. In some countries, this will only contain part of the postal code.

dmaID.title: Designated Market Area
dmaID.description: The Nielsen Media Research designated market area.

msaID.title: Metropolitan Statistical Area
msaID.description: The Metropolitan Statistical Area in the USA where the observation occurred.

primary.title: Primary
primary.description: Primary address indicator. A Profile can have only one `primary` address at a given point of time.

label.title: Label
label.description: Free form name of the address.

street1.title: Street 1
street1.description: Primary Street level information, apartment number, street number and street name.

region.title: Region
region.description: The region, county, or district portion of the address.

postOfficeBox.title: Post Office Box
postOfficeBox.description: Post office box of the address.

country.title: Country
country.description: The name of the government-administered territory. Other than `xdm:countryCode`, this is a free-form field that can have the country name in any language.

status.title: Status
status.description: An indication as to the ability to use the address.

statusReason.title: Status Reason
statusReason.description: A description of the current status.

lastVerifiedDate.title: Last Verified Date
lastVerifiedDate.description: The date that the address was last verified as still belonging to the person.

addressErrorCount.title: Address Error Count
addressErrorCount.description: Number of consecutive errors when sending to this address.

statusReason.title: Status Reason
statusReason.description: A description of the current status.

lastVerifiedDate.title: Last Verified Date
lastVerifiedDate.description: The date that the address was last verified as still belonging to the person.

addressErrorCount.title: Address Error Count
addressErrorCount.description: Number of consecutive errors when sending to this address.

primary.title: Primary
primary.description:
Primary email indicator.

A Profile can have only one `primary` email address at a given point of time.

address.title: Address
address.description: The technical address, e.g 'name@domain.com' as commonly defined in RFC2822 and subsequent standards.

label.title: Label
label.description: Additional display information that maybe available, e.g MS Outlook rich address controls display 'John Smith smithjr@company.uk', the 'John Smith' part is data that would be placed in the label.

type.title: Type
type.description: The way the account relates to the person. e.g 'work' or 'personal'

status.title: Status
status.description: An indication as to the ability to use the email address.

statusReason.title: Status Reason
statusReason.description: A description of the current status.

primary.title: Primary
primary.description:
Primary email indicator.

A Profile can have only one `primary` email address at a given point of time.

address.title: Address
address.description: The technical address, e.g 'name@domain.com' as commonly defined in RFC2822 and subsequent standards.

label.title: Label
label.description: Additional display information that maybe available, e.g MS Outlook rich address controls display 'John Smith smithjr@company.uk', the 'John Smith' part is data that would be placed in the label.

status.title: Status
status.description: An indication as to the ability to use the email address.

statusReason.title: Status Reason
statusReason.description: A description of the current status.

primary.title: Primary
primary.description:
Primary phone number indicator.

Unlike for Address or EmailAddress, there can be multiple primary phone numbers; one per communication channel.
The communication channel is defined by the type:

* `textMessaging`: type = `mobile`
* `phone`: type = `home` | `work` | `unknown`
* `fax`: type = `fax`

number.title: Number
number.description: The phone number. Note the phone number is a string and may include meaningful characters such as brackets (), hyphens - or characters to indicate sub dialing identifiers like extensions x. E.g 1-353(0)18391111 or +613 9403600x1234.

extension.title: Extension
extension.description: The internal dialing number used to call from a private exchange, operator or switchboard.

status.title: Status
status.description: An indication as to the ability to use the phone number.

statusReason.title: Status Reason
statusReason.description: A description of the current status.

validity.title: Validity
validity.description: A level of technical correctness of the phone number.

optInOut.title: OptInOut
optInOut.description:
Describes a users opting in and out preferences for communication by medium
and communication type.

email.description: Communication preference for the outbound channel identified through its URL by the name of the property.

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.
meta:enum.out: Opt-Out: the user declines to receive any messages on this channel

phone.description: Communication preference for the outbound channel identified through its URL by the name of the property.

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.
meta:enum.out: Opt-Out: the user declines to receive any messages on this channel

sms.description: Communication preference for the outbound channel identified through its URL by the name of the property.

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.
meta:enum.out: Opt-Out: the user declines to receive any messages on this channel

fax.description: Communication preference for the outbound channel identified through its URL by the name of the property.

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.
meta:enum.out: Opt-Out: the user declines to receive any messages on this channel

directMail.description: Communication preference for the outbound channel identified through its URL by the name of the property.

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.
meta:enum.out: Opt-Out: the user declines to receive any messages on this channel

adm.description: Communication preference for the outbound channel identified through its URL by the name of the property.

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.
meta:enum.out: Opt-Out: the user declines to receive any messages on this channel

apns.description: Communication preference for the outbound channel identified through its URL by the name of the property.

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.
meta:enum.out: Opt-Out: the user declines to receive any messages on this channel

baidu.description: Communication preference for the outbound channel identified through its URL by the name of the property.

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.
meta:enum.out: Opt-Out: the user declines to receive any messages on this channel

gcm.description: Communication preference for the outbound channel identified through its URL by the name of the property.

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.
meta:enum.out: Opt-Out: the user declines to receive any messages on this channel

line.description: Communication preference for the outbound channel identified through its URL by the name of the property.

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.
meta:enum.out: Opt-Out: the user declines to receive any messages on this channel

mpns.description: Communication preference for the outbound channel identified through its URL by the name of the property.

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.
meta:enum.out: Opt-Out: the user declines to receive any messages on this channel

wechat.description: Communication preference for the outbound channel identified through its URL by the name of the property.

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.
meta:enum.out: Opt-Out: the user declines to receive any messages on this channel

wns.description: Communication preference for the outbound channel identified through its URL by the name of the property.

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.
meta:enum.out: Opt-Out: the user declines to receive any messages on this channel

globalOptout.title: Global Opt-out
globalOptout.description: Do not contact this profile on any outbound channel.

pushNotificationTokens.title: Push Notification Tokens
pushNotificationTokens.description:
Push notification tokens are used to communicate with applications that
are installed on devices or SaaS application accounts.

token.title: Token
token.description:
The service specific token used to address the application for
communication. e.g an Apple APN ID or a Google GCM ID.

registrationDate.title: Registration Date
registrationDate.description:
Date and time when the profile has authorized its application to receive
push notifications.

deregistrationDate.title: Deregistration Date
deregistrationDate.description: Date and time when the profile has disabled push notifications on the application.

environment.title: Environment
environment.description: Environment of at the time of the registration.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the application environment.

browserDetails.title: Browser Details
browserDetails.description: The browser specific details such as browser name, version, javascript version, user agent string, accept language.

userAgent.title: User Agent
userAgent.description: The HTTP User-Agent string from the client request.

cookiesEnabled.title: Allows Cookies
cookiesEnabled.description: The current user agent settings allow for the writing of cookies.'

javaScriptEnabled.title: JavaScript Enabled
javaScriptEnabled.description: If JavaScript was enabled in the device this observation was made from.

javaScriptVersion.title: JavaScript Version
javaScriptVersion.description: The version of JavaScript supported during the observation.

javaEnabled.title: Java Enabled
javaEnabled.description: If Java was enabled in the device this observation was made from.

javaVersion.title: Java Version
javaVersion.description: The version of Java supported during the observation.

quicktimeVersion.title: Quicktime Version
quicktimeVersion.description: The version of Apple Quicktime supported during the observation.

thirdPartyCookiesEnabled.title: Allows Third-party Cookies
thirdPartyCookiesEnabled.description: If third-party cookies were enabled when this observation was made.

viewportHeight.title: Viewport Height
viewportHeight.description: The vertical size (in pixels) of the window the experience was displayed inside. For a web view event, the browser viewport height.

viewportWidth.title: Viewport Width
viewportWidth.description: The horizontal size (in pixels) of the window the experience was displayed inside. For a web view event, the browser viewport width.

operatingSystem.title: Operating System
operatingSystem.description: The name of the operating system used when the observation was made. This attribute should not contain any version information i.e. 10.5.3, but can contain *edition* designations such as 'Ultimate', or 'Professional'.

operatingSystemVersion.title: Operating System Version
operatingSystemVersion.description: The full version identifier for the operating system used when the observation was made. Versions are generally numerically composed, but may be in a vendor defined format.

operatingSystemVendor.title: Operating System Vendor
operatingSystemVendor.description: The name of the operating system vendor used when the observation was made.

colorDepth.title: Color Depth
colorDepth.description: The number of bits used for each color component of a single pixel.

viewportHeight.title: Viewport Height
viewportHeight.description: The vertical size (in pixels) of the window the experience was displayed inside. For a web view event, the browser viewport height.

viewportWidth.title: Viewport Width
viewportWidth.description: The horizontal size (in pixels) of the window the experience was displayed inside. For a web view event, the browser viewport width.

carrier.title: Mobile Network Carrier
carrier.description: A mobile network carrier or MNO, also known as a wireless service provider, wireless carrier, cellular company, or mobile network carrier, is a provider of services wireless communications that owns or controls all the elements necessary to sell and deliver services to an end user.

ipV4.title: IPv4
ipV4.description: The numerical label assigned to a device participating in a computer network that uses the Internet Protocol for communication.

ipV6.title: IPv6
ipV6.description: The numerical label assigned to a device participating in a computer network that uses the Internet Protocol for communication.

typeID.title: Type Identifier
typeID.description: An identifier for the device. This may be an identifier from Device Atlas or another service that identifies the hardware that is being used.

typeIDService.title: Type Identifier Service
typeIDService.description: The namespace of the service that is used to identify the device type.

manufacturer.title: Manufacturer
manufacturer.description: The name of the organization who owns the design and creation of the Device. For example, 'Apple' is the manufacturer of the iPhone.

model.title: Model
model.description: The name of the model for the Device. This is the common, human-readable or marketing name for the Device. The 'iPhone 6S' is a particular model of mobile phone.

modelNumber.title: Model Number
modelNumber.description: The unique model number designation assigned by the manufacturer for this Device. Model numbers are not versions, but unique identifiers that identify a particular model configuration. While the model for a particular phone might be 'iPhone 6S' the model number would be 'A1633', or 'A1634' based on configuration at the time of sale.

screenHeight.title: Screen Height
screenHeight.description: The number of veritcal pixels of the device's active display in its default orientation.

screenWidth.title: Screen Width
screenWidth.description: The number of horizontal pixels of the device's active display in its default orientation.

colorDepth.title: Color Depth
colorDepth.description: The number of colors the display is able to represent.

application.title: Application
application.description: Application registered to receive Push Notifications.

channel.title: Communication Channel
channel.description: Channels for communicating with customers or users.

_id.description: The ID uniquely identifies the channel. Each specific experience channel defines a constant `@id`.

mode.description: How experiences are delivered in this channel.

meta:enum.push: The publisher of an experience can initiate an experience by sending a message into the channel. Most `push` channels involve some form of subscription or opt-in.
meta:enum.pull: The consumer can initiate an experience by requesting a location in the channel. Most `pull` channels give publishers some control how the experience is then delivered.
meta:enum.bidirectional: Both `push` and `pull` interaction modes are supported by the channel.

_type.description: The `@type` property is used to provide a rough classification of channels with similar properties.

meta:enum.web: The world wide web, including mobile web

contentTypes.description: The content types that this channel can deliver.

items.description: The `@type` of an XDM-defined content type that is supported by this channel.

metricTypes.description: The metrics that can be collected in this channel.

items.description: The `@type` of an XDM-defined metric that is supported by this channel.

locationTypes.description: The types of locations (virtual places) that this channel consists of and can deliver content to.

items.description: The `@type` of an XDM-defined location (virtual place) that this channel can contain.

orgUnit.title: Organizational Unit
orgUnit.description: The unit within the organization owning the profile. This can be used to reference the organization details maintained in another dataset.

_id.title: Identifier
_id.description: The ID associated with this organizational unit.

label.title: Label of the organizational unit.
label.description: The user-friendly name for the organizational unit.

geoUnit.title: Geographical Unit
geoUnit.description: The geographical unit within the organization owning the profile. This can be used to reference the geographical information maintained in another dataset.

_id.title: Identifier
_id.description: The ID associated with this geographical unit.

label.title: Label of the geographical unit.
label.description: The user-friendly name for the geographical unit.

preferredLanguage.title: Preferred Language
preferredLanguage.description: Describes the preferred system of communication used by the profile. Language codes are expressed in BCP 47 format.

timeZone.title: Time Zone
timeZone.description: Describes which time zone the profile is present in, most frequently/the time zone preferred by the profile. Time zones are expressed according to the IETF tz database: https://www.ietf.org/timezones/tzdb-2016i/tz-link.htm

emailFormat.title: Email Format
emailFormat.description: Email format preferred by the profile. This can be rich text/plain text

subscriptions.title: Subscriptions
subscriptions.description: Subscriptions that this profile is entitled to including terminated, expired or exhausted subscriptions.

_id.title: Identifier
_id.description: Unique identifier for the subscription instance.

firstName.title: First name
firstName.description:
The first segment of the name in the writing order most commonly accepted in the language of the name. In many cultures this is the preferred personal or given name.

The `firstName` and `lastName` properties have been introduced to maintain compatibility with existing systems that model names in a simplified, non-semantic, and non-internationalizable way. Using `xdm:fullName` is always preferable.

lastName.title: Last name
lastName.description:
The last segment of the name in the writing order most commonly accepted in the language of the name. In many cultures this is the inherited family name, surname, patronymic, or matronymic name.

The `firstName` and `lastName` properties have been introduced to maintain compatibility with existing systems that model names in a simplified, non-semantic, and non-internationalizable way. Using `xdm:fullName` is always preferable.

middleName.title: Middle name
middleName.description: Middle, alternative, or additional names supplied between the first name and last name.

courtesyTitle.title: Courtesy title
courtesyTitle.description:
Normally an abbreviation of a persons *title*, *honorific*, or *salutation*.
The `courtesyTitle` is used in front of full or last name in opening texts.
e.g Mr. Miss. or Dr J. Smith.

fullName.title: Full name
fullName.description: The full name of the person, in writing order most commonly accepted in the language of the name.

birthDay.title: Birth day
birthDay.description: The day of the month a person was born (1-31).

birthMonth.title: Birth month
birthMonth.description: The month of the year a person was born (1-12).

birthYear.title: Birth year
birthYear.description: The year a person was born including the century (yyyy, e.g 1983).

repositoryCreatedBy.title: Created by User Identifier
repositoryCreatedBy.description: User id who has created the entity.

repositoryLastModifiedBy.title: Modified by User Identifier
repositoryLastModifiedBy.description:
User id who last modified the entity.
At creation time, `modifiedByUser` is set as `createdByUser`.

createdByBatchID.title: Created by Batch Identifier
createdByBatchID.description: The Data Set Files in Catalog Services which has been originating the creation of the entity.

modifiedByBatchID.title: Modified by Batch Identifier
modifiedByBatchID.description:
The last Data Set Files in Catalog Services which has modified the entity.
At creation time, `modifiedByBatchID` is set as `createdByBatchID`.

createDate.description: The server date and time when the resource was created in the repository, such as when an asset file is first uploaded or a directory is created by the server as the parent of a new asset. The Date Time property should conform to ISO 8601 standard. An example form is "2004-10-23T12:00:00-06:00".

lastModifiedDate.description: The server date and time when the resource was most recently modified in the repository, such as when a new version of an asset is uploaded or a directory's child resource is added or removed. The Date Time property should conform to ISO 8601 standard. An example form is "2004-10-23T12:00:00-06:00".

device.title: Device
device.description: The device linked to the subscription.

typeID.title: Type Identifier
typeID.description: An identifier for the device. This may be an identifier from Device Atlas or another service that identifies the hardware that is being used.

typeIDService.title: Type Identifier Service
typeIDService.description: The namespace of the service that is used to identify the device type.

manufacturer.title: Manufacturer
manufacturer.description: The name of the organization who owns the design and creation of the Device. For example, 'Apple' is the manufacturer of the iPhone.

model.title: Model
model.description: The name of the model for the Device. This is the common, human-readable or marketing name for the Device. The 'iPhone 6S' is a particular model of mobile phone.

modelNumber.title: Model Number
modelNumber.description: The unique model number designation assigned by the manufacturer for this Device. Model numbers are not versions, but unique identifiers that identify a particular model configuration. While the model for a particular phone might be 'iPhone 6S' the model number would be 'A1633', or 'A1634' based on configuration at the time of sale.

screenHeight.title: Screen Height
screenHeight.description: The number of veritcal pixels of the device's active display in its default orientation.

screenWidth.title: Screen Width
screenWidth.description: The number of horizontal pixels of the device's active display in its default orientation.

colorDepth.title: Color Depth
colorDepth.description: The number of colors the display is able to represent.

environment.title: Environment
environment.description:
Environment of the subscription.

This can be either then known environment at the time of the subscription
or the environment of the application for subscriptions related to an
Application.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the application environment.

browserDetails.title: Browser Details
browserDetails.description: The browser specific details such as browser name, version, javascript version, user agent string, accept language.

userAgent.title: User Agent
userAgent.description: The HTTP User-Agent string from the client request.

cookiesEnabled.title: Allows Cookies
cookiesEnabled.description: The current user agent settings allow for the writing of cookies.'

javaScriptEnabled.title: JavaScript Enabled
javaScriptEnabled.description: If JavaScript was enabled in the device this observation was made from.

javaScriptVersion.title: JavaScript Version
javaScriptVersion.description: The version of JavaScript supported during the observation.

javaEnabled.title: Java Enabled
javaEnabled.description: If Java was enabled in the device this observation was made from.

javaVersion.title: Java Version
javaVersion.description: The version of Java supported during the observation.

quicktimeVersion.title: Quicktime Version
quicktimeVersion.description: The version of Apple Quicktime supported during the observation.

thirdPartyCookiesEnabled.title: Allows Third-party Cookies
thirdPartyCookiesEnabled.description: If third-party cookies were enabled when this observation was made.

viewportHeight.title: Viewport Height
viewportHeight.description: The vertical size (in pixels) of the window the experience was displayed inside. For a web view event, the browser viewport height.

viewportWidth.title: Viewport Width
viewportWidth.description: The horizontal size (in pixels) of the window the experience was displayed inside. For a web view event, the browser viewport width.

operatingSystem.title: Operating System
operatingSystem.description: The name of the operating system used when the observation was made. This attribute should not contain any version information i.e. 10.5.3, but can contain *edition* designations such as 'Ultimate', or 'Professional'.

operatingSystemVersion.title: Operating System Version
operatingSystemVersion.description: The full version identifier for the operating system used when the observation was made. Versions are generally numerically composed, but may be in a vendor defined format.

operatingSystemVendor.title: Operating System Vendor
operatingSystemVendor.description: The name of the operating system vendor used when the observation was made.

colorDepth.title: Color Depth
colorDepth.description: The number of bits used for each color component of a single pixel.

viewportHeight.title: Viewport Height
viewportHeight.description: The vertical size (in pixels) of the window the experience was displayed inside. For a web view event, the browser viewport height.

viewportWidth.title: Viewport Width
viewportWidth.description: The horizontal size (in pixels) of the window the experience was displayed inside. For a web view event, the browser viewport width.

carrier.title: Mobile Network Carrier
carrier.description: A mobile network carrier or MNO, also known as a wireless service provider, wireless carrier, cellular company, or mobile network carrier, is a provider of services wireless communications that owns or controls all the elements necessary to sell and deliver services to an end user.

ipV4.title: IPv4
ipV4.description: The numerical label assigned to a device participating in a computer network that uses the Internet Protocol for communication.

ipV6.title: IPv6
ipV6.description: The numerical label assigned to a device participating in a computer network that uses the Internet Protocol for communication.

SKU.title: SKU
SKU.description: Stock Keeping Unit, a generally unique identifier for a product.

planName.title: Plan Name
planName.description: The human readable name for the subscription.

type.title: Type
type.description: The scope of entitlement in relation to how many people are covered by the subscription.

country.title: Country
country.description: The country that the subscription contractual/agreement terms are rooted in.

endDate.title: End Date
endDate.description: The date the current subscription term ends.

term.title: Term
term.description: The numeric value of the term.

termUnitOfTime.title: Term Unit Of Time
termUnitOfTime.description: The unit of time for the term period.

renew.title: Renew
renew.description: The agreed way that the subscription may continue after the end date.

topUp.title: Top Up
topUp.description: Agreed terms for how consumable aspects of a subscription are repurchased during a billing period.

status.title: Status
status.description: The current status of the subscription.

contractID.title: Contract ID
contractID.description: Unique ID for the contract that governs this subscription.

paymentMethod.title: Payment Method
paymentMethod.description: The payment method for recurring payments.

billingStartDate.title: Billing Start Date
billingStartDate.description: The date when the first bill is due.

chargeMethod.title: Charge Method
chargeMethod.description: The way the billing is setup to charge the customer.

category.title: Category
category.description: The main, top level categorization of this type of subscription.

subCategory.title: Sub Category
subCategory.description: The specific sub categorization of the subscription.

revision.title: Revision
revision.description: The identification between subscriptions of the same name and category hierarchy.

reason.title: Reason
reason.description: The general intent the member has for the use of the subscription.

testProfile.title: Test Profile
testProfile.description: Indicates the `profile` record is for use in testing/verification purposes and should not be automatically included in normal operation(s).

segmentID.title: Segment ID
segmentID.description: The identity of the segment or snapshot definition in with the domain of the specific system that processes that type of segment.

_id.title: Identifier
_id.description: Identity of the Segment in the related namespace.

namespace.title: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace associated with the `xid` attribute.

code.title: Code
code.description: The code is a human readable identifier for the namespace and can be used to request the technical namespace id which is used for identity graph processing.

xid.title: Experience Identifier
xid.description: When present, this value represents a cross-namespace identifier that is unique across all namespace-scoped identifiers in all namespaces.

version.title: Version
version.description: The version of the segment definition used in this segment assertion. Version can be omitted in audience lists when all memberships versions are the same.

lastQualificationTime.title: Last Qualification Time
lastQualificationTime.description: The timestamp when the assertion of segment membership was made.

validUntil.title: Valid Until
validUntil.description: The timestamp for when the segment assertion should nolonger be assumed to be valid and should either be ignored or revalidated.

status.title: Status
status.description: Is the segment participation realized as part of the current request.

meta:enum.existing: Entity continues to be in the segment
